2W0161








[solution]		 _____ 2W0162








[solution]      [Next]
2W0163








[solution]		 _____ 2W0164








[solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0161
    • Simply 1. a7 and black is helpless
    • to prevent 2.
    • a8=Q

    		_____
  • 2W0162
    • 1. Rb1+ king moves and 2. Qc3
    • mate! Is there another way?

  • 2W0163
    • 1. Qf6 forces mate unless black
    • plays 1. ... d4 allows 2. Qxb2

    		_____
  • 2W0164
    • 1. Qf6 threatening mate on g7. 1.
    • ... Qf8 2. Bxf8
    • wins

    2W0165








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0166








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0167








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0168








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0165
    • 1. Qf3+ Kd4 (forced) 2. Rd1 pins
    • the Queen to the
    • king.

    		_____
  • 2W0166
    • 1. Bg5+ f6 2. Bxf6 mate. (1. Ba3+
    • works too but takes longer.)

  • 2W0167
    • Although 1. Bxa8 is winning, better
    • is 1. Qg7+ and 2.
    • Qxh8+

    		_____
  • 2W0168
    • 1. Nb6+ creates a nice fork. Rxb6
    • 2. Bxb6
    • with an attack still.

    2W0169








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0170








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0171








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0172








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0169
    • 1. Rd7+ Kf8 2. Qf7 mate or 1.
    • Rf8+!! and 2. Qf7
    • mate!

    		_____
  • 2W0170
    • 1. Rh8 and black must give up a
    • pawn or allow checkmate on move 2.

  • 2W0171
    • 1. Ra6+ and then 2. Ra7+ skewers
    • the king to the pawn
    • on h7.

    		_____
  • 2W0172
    • 1. Nf6+!! if 1. ... Kh8 2. Qxg8
    • mate. If 1. ... Nxf6 2. Qxc7
    • wins

    2W0173








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0174








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0175








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0176








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0173
    • 1. Qd7+ and now black gives up his
    • queen or allows Kf8 2. Re8 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0174
    • 1. Rxf5 and now if black recaptures
    • the rook then 2.
    • Nf7+ wins.

  • 2W0175
    • 1. Qxc8 Rxc8 2. Bxb6 Nxb6 wins the
    • exchange. if 1. ... Qxe3 2. Qxa8

    		_____
  • 2W0176
    • 1. Ra1 traps the queen. No good is
    • 1. ... Ne4 because of 2. Qg7 mate.

    2W0177








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0178








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0179








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0180








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0177
    • 1. Bb2+ d4 2. Bxd4+ skewers the
    • King on f6 with the
    • rook on h8.

    		_____
  • 2W0178
    • Either 1. Qh8! or queen to the c
    • file check wins the knight on move
    • 2.

  • 2W0179
    • 1. Bxc4 (easier than Qxc6+) Bxc4
    • 2. Qxc6+ wins the
    • bishop on c4.

    		_____
  • 2W0180
    • 1. Nc4 attacking the queen and then
    • 2. Nd6 forking
    • the two rooks.
